member.name: T:Jcd.SRecord.Extensions.CharExtensions
member.summary: A set of utility methods for interacting with chars.

member.name: M:Jcd.SRecord.Extensions.CharExtensions.IsHexDigit(System.Char)
member.summary: Returns true if a character is a hexadecimal digit.
member.param: the character to inspect.

member.name: M:Jcd.SRecord.Extensions.CharExtensions.ThrowArgumentExceptionIfNotValidForSRecordComment(System.Char)
member.summary: Throws an ArgumentException if the character can't be used for an SRecord comment.
member.param: the character to check.
member.exception: Thrown if the character is invalid.

member.name: T:Jcd.SRecord.Extensions.HexStringConversions
member.summary: A set of extension methods to help in converting to and from hexadecimal representations of bytes

member.name: M:Jcd.SRecord.Extensions.HexStringConversions.HexStringToBytes(System.String)
member.summary: Converts a sequence of hexadecimal characters into the equivalent bytes.
member.param: the text to convert.
member.returns: The sequence of bytes represented by the hex string.

member.name: M:Jcd.SRecord.Extensions.HexStringConversions.BytesToHexString(System.Collections.Generic.IReadOnlyCollection{System.Byte},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Convert a sequence of bytes into a string of hexadecimal values.
member.param: the bytes to convert
makes the A-F range uppercase when true, lowercase otherwise

member.name: T:Jcd.SRecord.IO.ISRecordElementFormatter
member.summary: Defines the operations necessary to support formatting SRecordElements to lines of text.

member.name: M:Jcd.SRecord.IO.ISRecordElementFormatter.Format(Jcd.SRecord.IO.SRecordElement)
member.summary: Formats an SRecordElement as a element of text.
member.param: the element to format.
member.returns: Null indicates no element was generated. String.Empty indicates that a blank element was generated. SRecordElementWriter will discard null results. Depending on options settings, it may write blank lines.

member.summary: An event indicating that formatting has begun.

member.name: E:Jcd.SRecord.IO.ISRecordElementFormatter.Formatted
member.summary: An event that indicates formatting has finished.

member.summary: Defines the operations necessary to parse SRecordElements from text.

member.name: P:Jcd.SRecord.IO.ISRecordElementParser.AllowComments

member.name: T:Jcd.SRecord.IO.SRecordDocument
member.summary: Represents an SRecord document. This is a simple document reader/writer. No S37, or other semantics are enforced.

member.name: P:Jcd.SRecord.IO.SRecordDocument.Elements
member.summary: Gets a mutable collection of SRecordElements contained in this document.

member.name: P:Jcd.SRecord.IO.SRecordDocument.SRecords
member.summary: Gets an immutable collection of just the SRecord entries contained in the Elements collection.

member.name: P:Jcd.SRecord.IO.SRecordDocument.Parser
member.summary: Gets the instance of the parser in use by this SRecordDocument.

member.name: P:Jcd.SRecord.IO.SRecordDocument.Formatter
member.summary: Gets the instance of the formatter used by this SRecordDocument.

member.name: M:Jcd.SRecord.IO.SRecordDocument.#ctor(Jcd.SRecord.IO.ISRecordElementParser,Jcd.SRecord.IO.ISRecordElementFormatter)
member.summary: Creates an instance of an SRecordDocument.
member.param: The parser to use for parsing SRecordElement text. If null the default one is used.
The formatter to use when writing SRecordElements. If null the default one is used.

member.name: M:Jcd.SRecord.IO.SRecordDocument.Read(Jcd.SRecord.IO.SRecordElementReader)
member.summary: Reads all of the remaining SRecordElement entries from the SRecordElementReader
member.param: The element reader.

member.name: M:Jcd.SRecord.IO.SRecordDocument.ReadAsync(Jcd.SRecord.IO.SRecordElementReader)
member.summary: Asynchronously reads all of the remaining SRecordElement entries from the SRecordElementReader
member.param: The element reader.

member.name: M:Jcd.SRecord.IO.SRecordDocument.Write(Jcd.SRecord.IO.SRecordElementWriter)
member.summary: Writes all of the SRecordElements in this document to the SRecordElementWriter
member.param: The SRecordElementWriter instance to write to.

member.summary: Asynchronously writes all of the SRecordElements in this document to the SRecordElementWriter
member.param: The SRecordElementWriter instance to write to.

member.name: M:Jcd.SRecord.IO.SRecordDocument.CreateFromFile(System.String,Jcd.SRecord.IO.ISRecordElementParser,Jcd.SRecord.IO.ISRecordElementFormatter)
member.summary: Creates a SRecordDocument using the provided parser and formatter Then loads data from the specified file path.
member.param: The file to read.
The parser. If null the default one is used.
The formatter to used. If null the default one is used.

The parser. If null the default one is used.
The formatter to used. If null the default one is used.

member.summary: Asynchronously loads data from the specified file path into the current SRecordDocument. This appends to any existing entries.
member.param: The file to read.

member.name: M:Jcd.SRecord.IO.SRecordDocument.LoadFile(System.String)
member.summary: Loads data from the specified file path into the current SRecordDocument. This appends to any existing entries.
member.param: The file to read.

member.name: M:Jcd.SRecord.IO.SRecordDocument.WriteFile(System.String)
member.summary: Creates or replaces a file at the specified path and writes all of the formatted SRecordElement data into the file.
member.param: The path of the file to write.

member.name: M:Jcd.SRecord.IO.SRecordDocument.WriteFileAsync(System.String)
member.summary: Asynchronously creates or replaces a file at the specified path and the writes all of the formatted SRecordElement data into the file.
member.param: The path of the file to write.

member.name: M:Jcd.SRecord.IO.SRecordDocument.CreateFromString(System.String,Jcd.SRecord.IO.ISRecordElementParser,Jcd.SRecord.IO.ISRecordElementFormatter)
member.summary: Creates a SRecordDocument using the provided parser and formatter Then loads data from the string.
member.param: The string to load.
The parser. If null the default one is used.
The formatter to used. If null the default one is used.

member.name: M:Jcd.SRecord.IO.SRecordDocument.LoadString(System.String)
member.summary: Loads data from the provided string into the current SRecordDocument. This appends to any existing entries.
member.param: The string to load.

member.name: T:Jcd.SRecord.IO.SRecordElement
member.summary: Represents a single line in an SRecordDocument

member.name: P:Jcd.SRecord.IO.SRecordElement.LineNumber
member.summary: The line in the file where the text was found.

member.name: P:Jcd.SRecord.IO.SRecordElement.SRecord
member.summary: The SRecord parsed from the line (if any)

member.name: P:Jcd.SRecord.IO.SRecordElement.Comment
member.summary: The comment text (lines starting with a ';' '#' ...etc are comment lines.)

member.name: P:Jcd.SRecord.IO.SRecordElement.ElementType
member.summary: True if the line recognized as an SRecord and/or comment. False otherwise. When false, OriginalLine should be populated with the extracted line of text, without end of line character(s). Also, ErrorMessage should be populated with the error encountered while trying to parse the line.

member.name: P:Jcd.SRecord.IO.SRecordElement.OriginalLine
member.summary: The original line of text. A well constructed parser will always provide this. The default one does.

member.name: P:Jcd.SRecord.IO.SRecordElement.ErrorMessage
member.summary: Contains a parser specific error message associated with attempting to parse this line.

member.name: P:Jcd.SRecord.IO.SRecordElement.Exception
member.summary: An exception that happened while trying to parse the line of text.

member.name: M:Jcd.SRecord.IO.SRecordElement.#ctor(System.Int32,Jcd.SRecord.IO.SRecordElementType,Jcd.SRecord.SRecord,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Exception)
member.summary: Constructs an instance of an SRecordElement
member.param: The line number in the file.
The elementType of line.
the parsed and validated SRecord instance.
The comment text, without the comment character.
The original full text of the line.
An error message, populated when elementType is false.
An exception that occurred during parsing of the SRecord entry.

member.summary: Gets a flag indicating if the formatting attempt was successful.

member.summary: Gets the element that was formatted.

member.name: P:Jcd.SRecord.IO.SRecordElementFormattedEventArgs.FormattedText
member.summary: Gets the text resulting from formatting.

member.summary: Constructs an instance of SRecordElementFormattedEventArgs
member.param: A flag indicating if the formatting attempt was successful.
The element that was formatted.
The text resulting from formatting.

member.name: T:Jcd.SRecord.IO.SRecordElementFormatter
member.summary: Encapsulates the logic necessary to format an SRecordElement as a line of text.

member.name: F:Jcd.SRecord.IO.SRecordElementFormatter.Default
member.summary: Gets the default instance of SRecordElementFormatter

member.name: P:Jcd.SRecord.IO.SRecordElementFormatter.CurrentOptions
member.summary: Gets the currently configured options.

member.name: P:Jcd.SRecord.IO.SRecordElementFormatter.RecordFormatter
member.summary: Gets the currently configured ISRecordFormatter

member.name: M:Jcd.SRecord.IO.SRecordElementFormatter.#ctor(System.Nullable{Jcd.SRecord.IO.SRecordElementFormatter.Options},Jcd.SRecord.ISRecordFormatter)
member.summary: Constructs an instance of SRecordElementFormatter with the specified options and ISRecordFormatter.
member.param: The options to use, if null, Options.DefaultOptions is used.
The ISRecordFormatter to use. If null, SRecordFormatter.UppercaseHex is used.

member.name: T:Jcd.SRecord.IO.SRecordElementFormatter.Options
member.summary: Represents the formatting options desired when writing SRecordElement contents to an SRecordElementWriter.

member.name: F:Jcd.SRecord.IO.SRecordElementFormatter.Options.EmitOriginalText
member.summary: Tells the formatter to ignore all other directives, and just emit the original line of text.

member.name: F:Jcd.SRecord.IO.SRecordElementFormatter.Options.EmitComment
member.summary: Tells the formatter if end of line comments should be emitted.

member.name: F:Jcd.SRecord.IO.SRecordElementFormatter.Options.EmitSRecordContent
member.summary: Tells the formatter to emit the SRecord when present. This is usually true.

member.name: F:Jcd.SRecord.IO.SRecordElementFormatter.Options.EmitSpaceBeforeEndOfLineComment
member.summary: Tells the formatter if a space should be emitted before an end of line comment.

member.name: F:Jcd.SRecord.IO.SRecordElementFormatter.Options.EmitErrorLineAsCommentLine
member.summary: Indicates if the formatter should emit an error line as a commented out line. In order for a comment line to be emitted, EmitComment must also be true. If false, a blank line or null will be generated for error lines (depending on blank line handling).

member.name: F:Jcd.SRecord.IO.SRecordElementFormatter.Options.EmitBlankLineAsEmptyString
member.summary: Indicates if the formatter should emit a blank line as an empty string or null. When false, lines that would format to an empty string, become null instead.

member.name: F:Jcd.SRecord.IO.SRecordElementFormatter.Options.CommentCharacter
member.summary: The character to use when emitting a comment.

member.name: M:Jcd.SRecord.IO.SRecordElementFormatter.Options.#ctor(System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Char)
member.summary: Constructs a set of options to control the behavior of SRecordElementFormatter.
member.param: Tells the formatter to emit the SRecord when present.
Tells the formatter if end of line comments should be emitted.
Tells the formatter to ignore all other directives, and just emit the original line of text.

member.name: F:Jcd.SRecord.IO.SRecordElementFormatter.Options.OnlyEmitSRecordData
member.summary: A convenience instance that is configured to only emit SRecord line and only the SRecord data.

member.name: F:Jcd.SRecord.IO.SRecordElementFormatter.Options.OnlyEmitCommentData
member.summary: A convenience instance that is configured to only emit comment data.

member.name: F:Jcd.SRecord.IO.SRecordElementFormatter.Options.EmitSRecordAndCommentData
member.summary: A convenience instance that is configured to emit SRecord line and comment data.

member.name: F:Jcd.SRecord.IO.SRecordElementFormatter.Options.EmitSRecordAndCommentDataWithSpace
member.summary: A convenience instance that is configured to emit SRecord line and comment data. For end of line comments after SRecord data, a space is inserted before the comment character.

member.name: F:Jcd.SRecord.IO.SRecordElementFormatter.Options.CommentOutErrorLines
member.summary: A convenience instance that is configured to emit SRecord line and comment data. As well SRecordElements flagged as having an error will be emitted as commented out lines. (SRecordElement.OriginalLine is used, otherwise preserving the whole line.)

member.name: F:Jcd.SRecord.IO.SRecordElementFormatter.Options.OnlyEmitOriginalText
member.summary: A convenience instance that is configured to only emit the original text.

member.name: P:Jcd.SRecord.IO.SRecordElementFormatter.Options.DefaultOptions
member.summary: See EmitSRecordAndCommentDataWithSpace

member.name: P:Jcd.SRecord.IO.SRecordElementFormattingEventArgs.Element
member.summary: The element to be formatted.

member.name: M:Jcd.SRecord.IO.SRecordElementFormattingEventArgs.#ctor(Jcd.SRecord.IO.SRecordElement)
member.summary: Constructs a SRecordElementFormattingEventArgs instance.
member.param: The element to be formatted.

member.name: P:Jcd.SRecord.IO.SRecordElementParsedEventArgs.Element
member.summary: The parsed element containing the results of parsing. (successful, type parsed, error, error message, exception...etc.)

member.name: M:Jcd.SRecord.IO.SRecordElementParsedEventArgs.#ctor(Jcd.SRecord.IO.SRecordElement)
member.summary: Constructs an instance of SRecordElementParsedEventArgs.
member.param: The parsed element containing the results of parsing.

member.name: T:Jcd.SRecord.IO.SRecordElementParser
member.summary: Provides a default mechanism for parsing a line of text into an SRecordElement.

member.name: E:Jcd.SRecord.IO.SRecordElementParser.Parsing
member.summary: An event indicating parsing of a line of text has begun. The data on the argument is the original line of text.

member.name: E:Jcd.SRecord.IO.SRecordElementParser.Parsed
member.summary: An event indicating parsing has finished. The data on the argument is the element resulting from parsing.

member.name: P:Jcd.SRecord.IO.SRecordElementParser.RecordParser
member.summary: Gets the ISRecordParser instance used to parse the SRecord data from a line of text.

member.name: P:Jcd.SRecord.IO.SRecordElementParser.CommentCharacters
member.summary: Gets a copy of the comment characters in use.

member.name: F:Jcd.SRecord.IO.SRecordElementParser.DefaultCommentCharacters
member.summary: The default set of comment characters we'll parse.

member.name: P:Jcd.SRecord.IO.SRecordElementParser.Default
member.summary: A default instance configured with reasonable, flexible, defaults. It should parse most any line.

member.name: F:Jcd.SRecord.IO.SRecordElementParser.Flexible
member.summary: An SRecordElementParser configured to accept either '#' or ';' as comment characters, and to allow up to 250-252 (SRecordType dependent) data bytes in the SRecord data.

member.name: F:Jcd.SRecord.IO.SRecordElementParser.FlexibleNoComments
member.summary: An SRecordElementParser configured to accept no comments, and to allow up to 250-252 (SRecordType dependent) data bytes in the SRecord data.

member.name: F:Jcd.SRecord.IO.SRecordElementParser.Strict
member.summary: An SRecordElementParser configured to accept either '#' or ';' as comment characters, and to allow up to 32 (SRecordType dependent) data bytes in the SRecord data.

member.name: F:Jcd.SRecord.IO.SRecordElementParser.StrictNoComments
member.summary: An SRecordElementParser configured to accept no comments, and to allow up to 250-252 (SRecordType dependent) data bytes in the SRecord data.

member.name: P:Jcd.SRecord.IO.SRecordElementParser.AllowComments
member.summary: Indicates if comments are allowed. To Allow comments pass a set of recognized comment characters in to the constructor.

member.name: M:Jcd.SRecord.IO.SRecordElementParser.#ctor(Jcd.SRecord.ISRecordParser,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Char})
member.summary: Constructs an SRecordElementParser from an ISRecordParser and an optional set of comment characters.
member.param: The ISRecordParser instance to use.
The comment characters to accept when parsing.

member.summary: Parses a line of text into an SRecordElement.
member.param: The line number.
The raw text.
member.returns: an SRecordElement describing the parsing results.

member.summary: The line number for the line of text being parsed.

member.name: P:Jcd.SRecord.IO.SRecordElementParsingEventArgs.OriginalLineOfText
member.summary: The original line of text to parse.

member.name: M:Jcd.SRecord.IO.SRecordElementParsingEventArgs.#ctor(System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Constructs a new instance of SRecordElementParsingEventArgs
member.param: The line number.
The original line of text.

member.name: T:Jcd.SRecord.IO.SRecordElementReader
member.summary: A forward only SRecordElement stream/string reader. This class always disposes its TextReader when disposed.

member.name: P:Jcd.SRecord.IO.SRecordElementReader.CurrentLine
member.summary: The line number of the most recently read line. This is 0 if nothing has been read and number of the last line in the file, if all lines have been read.

member.summary: Indicates if all of the data has been read.

member.name: F:Jcd.SRecord.IO.SRecordElementType.Error

member.name: T:Jcd.SRecord.ISRecordFormatter

member.summary: Indicates if the hex numbers should be uppercase (true) or lowercase (false).

member.name: M:Jcd.SRecord.ISRecordFormatter.Format(Jcd.SRecord.SRecord)
member.summary: Converts an SRecord into its ASCII-HEX representation.
member.param: the record to format

member.name: T:Jcd.SRecord.ISRecordParser
member.summary: Defines the operations necessary in order to support parsing text into SRecord instances.

member.name: M:Jcd.SRecord.ISRecordParser.Parse(System.String)
member.summary: Parses a line of text into an SRecord, ignoring trailing whitespace.
member.param: The line of text to parse.
member.returns: An SRecord instance if it was successfully parsed.

member.name: M:Jcd.SRecord.ISRecordParser.TryParse(System.String,Jcd.SRecord.SRecord@)
member.summary: Tries parsing a line of text into an SRecord
member.param: the text to try parsing.
The result of parsing. null if not parsed.

member.name: T:Jcd.SRecord.SRecord
member.summary: Represents a single SRecord entry in an s-record file. This is an immutable type. To edit the contents, create a new one with the altered data buffer, address, and/or type.
member.remarks: Further reading about the SRecord format can be done at the Ubuntu manpage and the wikipedia page.

member.name: F:Jcd.SRecord.SRecord.CheckSumByteLength
member.summary: The length of the checksum, in bytes.

member.name: F:Jcd.SRecord.SRecord.CountByteLength
member.summary: The length of the count in bytes

member.name: F:Jcd.SRecord.SRecord.KeyCharLength
member.summary: The length of the record key in characters.

member.name: F:Jcd.SRecord.SRecord.MaxValueForCount
member.summary: The maximum value for the count field.

member.name: P:Jcd.SRecord.SRecord.Type
member.summary: The type of SRecord

member.name: P:Jcd.SRecord.SRecord.CountOfRemainingBytes
member.summary: The total count of the address, data, and checksum bytes.

member.name: P:Jcd.SRecord.SRecord.Address
member.summary: If applicable, the address for data to be written to, or in some cases, a count of preceding records.

member.name: P:Jcd.SRecord.SRecord.EndAddress
member.summary: The computed address of the last byte of data contained in this record. For records with 0 data length, this will contain the same value as Address.

member.name: P:Jcd.SRecord.SRecord.Data
member.summary: The data to be loaded into the address. (or in S0's case a descriptor for the file.)

member.name: P:Jcd.SRecord.SRecord.Checksum
member.summary: The checksum for the type, address, and data.

member.name: M:Jcd.SRecord.SRecord.#ctor(Jcd.SRecord.SRecordType,System.UInt32,System.Byte[])
member.summary: Constructs a mew SRecord instance.
member.param: The type descriptor for the SRecord
The data for the address field.
The data for the data field, if any.

member.name: M:Jcd.SRecord.SRecord.ComputeChecksum(Jcd.SRecord.SRecordType,System.Byte,System.UInt32,System.Byte[])
member.summary: Computes the checksum for the record.
member.param: The type descriptor for the record.
The count of bytes following
The data for the address field.
The data for the data field, if any.

member.name: T:Jcd.SRecord.SRecordFormatter
member.summary: Encapsulates the formatting logic required to emit a single SRecord with consistent hex value casing.

member.name: P:Jcd.SRecord.SRecordFormatter.EmitHexNumbersInUpperCase
member.summary: Indicates if the hex numbers should be uppercase (true) or lowercase (false)

member.name: F:Jcd.SRecord.SRecordFormatter.UppercaseHex
member.summary: And instance preconfigured to emit uppercase hex values.

member.name: F:Jcd.SRecord.SRecordFormatter.LowercaseHex
member.summary: An instance preconfigured to emit lowercase hex values.

member.name: P:Jcd.SRecord.SRecordFormatter.Default
member.summary: The default (uppercase) method of emitting an SRecord.

member.name: M:Jcd.SRecord.SRecordFormatter.Format(Jcd.SRecord.SRecord)
member.summary: Converts an SRecord into its ASCII-HEX representation.
member.param: the record to format

member.name: T:Jcd.SRecord.SRecordParser
member.summary: Provides facilities for parsing the textual SRecord format into its binary representation.

member.name: M:Jcd.SRecord.SRecordParser.#ctor(System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.String,Jcd.SRecord.SRecordType})
member.summary: Constructs an SRecordParser from a defined sRecord type lookup table.

member.name: M:Jcd.SRecord.SRecordParser.Parse(System.String)
member.summary: Parses a line of text into an SRecord, ignoring trailing whitespace.
member.param: The line of text to parse.
member.returns: An SRecord instance if it was successfully parsed.

member.name: M:Jcd.SRecord.SRecordParser.TryParse(System.String,Jcd.SRecord.SRecord@)
member.summary: Tries parsing a line of text into an SRecord
member.param: the text to try parsing.
The result of parsing. null if not parsed.

member.name: F:Jcd.SRecord.SRecordParser.Strict
member.summary: An instance configured to use Strict definitions.

member.name: F:Jcd.SRecord.SRecordParser.Flexible
member.summary: An instance configured to use Flexible definitions.

member.name: F:Jcd.SRecord.SRecordParser.Default
member.summary: An default instance. This is the same as Flexible.

member.name: M:Jcd.SRecord.SRecordParser.Create(System.Byte)
member.summary: Creates a new instance of an SRecordParser configured to parse records containing the configured maxDataBytesPerRecord.
member.remarks: When maxDataBytesPerRecord is greater than 250, the Flexible instance is used instead of creating a new one.

member.name: T:Jcd.SRecord.SRecordType
member.summary:
Represents the information required to identify and process various types of SRecords
as documented here

member.name: M:Jcd.SRecord.SRecordType.CreateLookup(System.Byte)
member.summary: Creates a lookup table of SRecordTypes.
member.param: The number of data bytes you want any S1,S2, or S3 record to hold.
member.returns: Returns a lookup table for record types.

member.name: F:Jcd.SRecord.SRecordType.KeyLength
member.summary: The length of the key in characters.

member.name: F:Jcd.SRecord.SRecordType.RecordStartCharacter
member.summary: The mandatory character that all SRecord types must start with 'S'.

member.name: F:Jcd.SRecord.SRecordType.Key
member.summary: The key for the type.

member.name: F:Jcd.SRecord.SRecordType.AddressLengthInBytes
member.summary: The number of bytes used to represent the address.

member.name: F:Jcd.SRecord.SRecordType.MaximumDataBytesAllowed
member.summary: The maximum number of bytes allowed in the data section for this type.

member.name: F:Jcd.SRecord.SRecordType.IsValid
member.summary: Indicates if the type is valid and recognized.
member.remarks: This is set by whatever is constructing the type. Usually this will be set at compile time. See, Strict and Flexible for examples.

member.name: F:Jcd.SRecord.SRecordType.RequiresSpecialHandling
member.summary: Indicates if the type requires special (i.e. non-standard handling. e.g. S4)

member.name: M:Jcd.SRecord.SRecordType.#ctor(System.String,System.Byte,System.Byte,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Constructs an SRecordType, which identifies how to properly process and/or parse an SRecord of the specified type, provided the key, address length, and maximum data bytes allowed.
member.remarks: This constructor is only intended to be used by people who will use it correctly. Typically you'll want to use Strict.FromKey or Flexible.FromKey instead.
member.param: The two character SRecord identifier. (S0..S9)
The byte length of the address
The maximum number of data bytes allowed.
Indicates if the type requires special handling. (S4 does)
Indicates if parsing recognized the key.

member.name: M:Jcd.SRecord.SRecordType.#ctor(System.String,System.Byte,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Constructs an SRecordType, which identifies how to properly process and/or parse an SRecord of the specified type, provided the key, address length. The maximum data length is computed from the following formula: MaximumDataBytesAllowed = SRecord.MaxValueForCount - SRecord.CheckSumByteLength - addressLengthInBytes;
member.remarks: This constructor is only intended to be used by people who will use it correctly. Typically you'll want to use Strict.FromKey or Flexible.FromKey instead.
member.param: The two character SRecord identifier. (S0..S9)
The byte length of the address
Indicates if the type requires special handling. (S4 does)
Indicates if parsing recognized the key.

member.name: T:Jcd.SRecord.SRecordType.Flexible
member.summary: Provides a collection and lookup mechanism for instances of configured to accept a flexible number of data bytes per record. The exact amount allowed varies per type and is 254 bytes minus the address length in bytes, for S0, S1, S2, S3, and S4. NOTE: S4 types always require special, implementation defined, handling.

member.name: F:Jcd.SRecord.SRecordType.Flexible.S0
member.summary: The identifier for S0 records. Address is 2 bytes, should always be 0. Maximum data bytes allowed 252 bytes.
member.remarks: This record contains vendor specific ASCII text comment represented as a series of hex digit pairs. There is a spec, seldom conformed to, outlined in the Ubuntu manpage.

member.name: F:Jcd.SRecord.SRecordType.Flexible.S1
member.summary: The identifier for S1 records. Address is 2 bytes. Maximum data bytes allowed 252 bytes.
member.remarks: This record type contains data that starts at the 16-bit address field.

member.name: F:Jcd.SRecord.SRecordType.Flexible.S2
member.summary: The identifier for S2 records. Address is 3 bytes. Maximum data bytes allowed 251 bytes.
member.remarks: This record type contains data that starts at a 24-bit address.

member.name: F:Jcd.SRecord.SRecordType.Flexible.S3
member.summary: The identifier for S3 records. Address is 4 bytes. Maximum data bytes allowed 250 bytes.
member.remarks: This record type contains data that starts at a 32-bit address.

member.name: F:Jcd.SRecord.SRecordType.Flexible.S4
member.summary: The identifier for S4 records. Address is 4 bytes. Maximum data bytes allowed 250 bytes.
member.remarks: Special handling required. This is vendor defined/reserved.

member.name: F:Jcd.SRecord.SRecordType.Flexible.S5
member.summary: The identifier for S5 records. Address is 2 bytes. No data allowed.
member.remarks: This record type is used to contain a 16-bit count of all S1, S2, or S3 records, stored in the address field. There are no data bytes for this record type. This record is used if the record count is less than or equal to 65,535 (0xFFFF).

member.name: F:Jcd.SRecord.SRecordType.Flexible.S6
member.summary: The identifier for S6 records. Address is 3 bytes. No data allowed.
member.remarks: This record type is used to contain a 24-bit count of all S1, S2, or S3 records, stored in the address field. There are no data bytes for this record type. This record is used if the record count is less than or equal to 16,777,215 (0xFFFFFF) and greater than 65,535 (0xFFFF) records.

member.name: F:Jcd.SRecord.SRecordType.Flexible.S7
member.summary: The identifier for S7 records. Address is 4 bytes. No data allowed. This is used to terminate a series of S3 records.
member.remarks: If an SRecord file is only used to program a memory device and the execution location is ignored, then an address of zero could be used.

member.name: F:Jcd.SRecord.SRecordType.Flexible.S8
member.summary: The identifier for S8 records. Address is 3 bytes. No data allowed. This is used to terminate a series of S2 records.
member.remarks: If an SRecord file is only used to program a memory device and the execution location is ignored, then an address of zero could be used.

member.name: F:Jcd.SRecord.SRecordType.Flexible.S9
member.summary: The identifier for S8 records. Address is 3 bytes. Maximum data bytes allowed 32 bytes.
member.remarks: This is used to terminate a series of S1 records. If a SRecord file is only used to program a memory device and the execution location is ignored, then an address of zero could be used.

member.name: F:Jcd.SRecord.SRecordType.Flexible.TypeLookup
member.summary: A key-based lookup for known Flexible (250-252 byte data max depending on record type) SRecordType instances.

member.name: M:Jcd.SRecord.SRecordType.Flexible.FromKey(System.String)
member.summary: Given a key, return an SRecordType instance describing it. Invalid keys will return
member.returns: A matching SRecordType or a new instance with IsValid set to false.

member.name: T:Jcd.SRecord.SRecordType.Strict
member.summary: Provides a collection and lookup mechanism for instances of configured to accept a maximum of 32 data bytes per record for S0, S1, S2, S3, and S4 record types. NOTE: S4 types always require special, implementation defined, handling.

member.name: F:Jcd.SRecord.SRecordType.Strict.MaxDataLength
member.summary: The maximum data any data bearing record may have

member.name: F:Jcd.SRecord.SRecordType.Strict.S0
member.summary: The identifier for S0 records. Address is 2 bytes, should always be 0. Maximum data bytes allowed 32 bytes.
member.remarks: This record contains vendor specific ASCII text comment represented as a series of hex digit pairs. There is a spec, seldom conformed to, outlined in the Ubuntu manpage.

member.name: F:Jcd.SRecord.SRecordType.Strict.S1
member.summary: The identifier for S1 records. Address is 2 bytes. Maximum data bytes allowed 32 bytes.
member.remarks: This record type contains data that starts at the 16-bit address field.

member.name: F:Jcd.SRecord.SRecordType.Strict.S2
member.summary: The identifier for S2 records. Address is 3 bytes. Maximum data bytes allowed 32 bytes.
member.remarks: This record type contains data that starts at a 24-bit address.

member.name: F:Jcd.SRecord.SRecordType.Strict.S3
member.summary: The identifier for S3 records. Address is 4 bytes. Maximum data bytes allowed 32 bytes.
member.remarks: This record type contains data that starts at a 32-bit address.

member.name: F:Jcd.SRecord.SRecordType.Strict.S4
member.summary: The identifier for S4 records. Address is 4 bytes. Maximum data bytes allowed 32 bytes.
member.remarks: Special handling required. This is vendor defined/reserved.

member.name: F:Jcd.SRecord.SRecordType.Strict.S5
member.summary: The identifier for S5 records. Address is 2 bytes. No data allowed.
member.remarks: This record type is used to contain a 16-bit count of all S1, S2, or S3 records, stored in the address field. There are no data bytes for this record type. This record is used if the record count is less than or equal to 65,535 (0xFFFF).

member.name: F:Jcd.SRecord.SRecordType.Strict.S6
member.summary: The identifier for S6 records. Address is 3 bytes. No data allowed.
member.remarks: This record type is used to contain a 24-bit count of all S1, S2, or S3 records, stored in the address field. There are no data bytes for this record type. This record is used if the record count is less than or equal to 16,777,215 (0xFFFFFF) and greater than 65,535 (0xFFFF) records.

member.name: F:Jcd.SRecord.SRecordType.Strict.S7
member.summary: The identifier for S7 records. Address is 4 bytes. No data allowed. This is used to terminate a series of S3 records.
member.remarks: If an SRecord file is only used to program a memory device and the execution location is ignored, then an address of zero could be used.

member.name: F:Jcd.SRecord.SRecordType.Strict.S8
member.summary: The identifier for S8 records. Address is 3 bytes. No data allowed. This is used to terminate a series of S2 records.
member.remarks: If an SRecord file is only used to program a memory device and the execution location is ignored, then an address of zero could be used.

member.name: F:Jcd.SRecord.SRecordType.Strict.S9
member.summary: The identifier for S8 records. Address is 3 bytes. No data allowed.
member.remarks: This is used to terminate a series of S1 records. If a SRecord file is only used to program a memory device and the execution location is ignored, then an address of zero could be used.

member.name: F:Jcd.SRecord.SRecordType.Strict.TypeLookup
member.summary: A key-based lookup for known Strict (32 byte data max) SRecordType instances.

member.name: M:Jcd.SRecord.SRecordType.Strict.FromKey(System.String)
member.summary: Given a key, return an SRecordType instance describing it. Invalid keys will return
member.returns: A matching SRecordType or a new instance with IsValid set to false.
